intro: Calyptrogyne pubescens, commonly known as the hairy calyptrogyne, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. The species is also noted for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic uses.
